meanings.definition: To convert a variable of a lower data type to a higher data type.
meanings.sent1: She was upcasting the integer to a double for more precision.
meanings.sent2: In programming, upcasting is essential for avoiding data loss.
meanings.sent3: The computer tried upcasting a small number to a larger one, but it got confused!
meanings.sent4: Upcasting is like turning a small cup into a big bucket in the digital world.
meanings.sent5: Imagine upcasting as upgrading your data type to a deluxe version.

meanings.definition: The act of casting an object to a superclass type.
meanings.sent1: The upcasting of the object allowed it to access superclass methods.
meanings.sent2: Developers often use upcasting to treat objects more generically.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the toy characters joked about upcasting to become superheroes.
meanings.sent4: Upcasting is like giving a toy car the powers of a superhero figurine.
meanings.sent5: The concept of upcasting can make your programming skills soar to new heights.
